Notice c is not being rehashed when it is brought up in the tree, so the root is NOT hash(d,hash(c)) but instead hash(d,c) == hash(hash(a,b),c).       r     /   \\    d     c   / \\  a   b"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"ccip/test/helpers/MerkleHelper.sol":"MerkleHelper"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"none"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[":forge-std/=foundry-lib/forge-std/src/"]},"sources":{"ccip/libraries/MerkleMultiProof.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9f2e5edd718cd1b5aa7143ca39ee50d7c15b8456ce32c49c10833c9ef3b0eb72","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://c2591501ed4b28164009e58166324634a0ce79a0599ee682d47d825f302a9955","dweb:/ipfs/QmeN35m4PFQDBc1ew2Q5koYNfchf8DcTemUmXVFVSuZV5t"]},"ccip/test/helpers/MerkleHelper.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb6324d568148723844be0c8a294cc034c1f2f3e0a30f6fed3ddf46c66f41c2be","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://2ed7809731caa9b834979a2b3a7370335fc0c0f167e9a86d8f9cac0e91e802f4","dweb:/ipfs/Qmbn8qdg9DzQEK4JsC6Pff9m31YKfDjFBH3ZRjd1Ue4Ppg"]}},"version":1}

computeNextLayer(bytes32[]).notice: Computes a single layer of a merkle proof by hashing each pair (i, i+1) for each i, i+2, i+4.. n. When an uneven number of leaves is supplied the last item is simply included as the last element in the result set and not hashed.

getMerkleRoot(bytes32[]).notice: Generate a Merkle Root from a full set of leaves. When a tree is unbalanced the value is brought up in the tree. For example consider (a,b,c) as leaves. This would result in the following tree with d being computed from hash(a,c) and the root r from hash(d,c). Notice c is not being rehashed when it is brought up in the tree, so the root is NOT hash(d,hash(c)) but instead hash(d,c) == hash(hash(a,b),c).       r     /   \    d     c   / \  a   b

documentation.text:
@notice Generate a Merkle Root from a full set of leaves. When a tree is unbalanced
 the value is brought up in the tree. For example consider (a,b,c) as leaves. This would
 result in the following tree with d being computed from hash(a,c) and the root r from
 hash(d,c). Notice c is not being rehashed when it is brought up in the tree, so the
 root is NOT hash(d,hash(c)) but instead hash(d,c) == hash(hash(a,b),c).
       r
     /   \
    d     c
   / \
  a   b
